ygData.subject: Re: Standardised Pricign Editorial on EQE
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree i decided to make items for my guild and only for people who had been customers before, i gave up pricing at the bottom of the price pool, i found some
ygData.messageBody:
I agree i decided to make items for my guild and only for people who had
been customers
before, i gave up pricing at the bottom of the price pool, i found some
people selling at cost just to make it hard on the rest of us to make
money(was actually told this by an enchanter wandering in north ro whoes
name i wont disclose), pretty bad i'd say.



Expermentor

Humble Keeper of the Elements Enchanter
Veeshan Server

Greg Short wrote:
>
> From: "Greg Short" <eq@...>
>
> I accidentally overwrote working on someone elses reply - it will be going
> back up when I get home from my night shift. Just so you know...
>
> As a side issue I have given up on ever trying to achieve standardised
> pricing. It just will never happen. EQ is a very different tradeskill
> related game since so many people trade magic items for their wares, and
> currency can come in many many forms of equipment. I am now a follower of
> the "if both sides are happy" principle. To me if both people are happy in
> a trade then good for them. But trying to force people to use standard
> prices simply will not happen - I have tried on my server and people just
> won't listen - good thing only two of us can work in plat right now heh.
>
> baels
>
